DataElement.preferredName: Person Torsades De Pointes Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response to determine eligibility for clinical trial participation for questions related to the patientÂ’s medical history with Torsades de pointes as outlined in the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Torsades De Pointes Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a history of Torsades De Pointes, an atypical rapid polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with a characteristic rotation of the QRS complex around the isoelectric baseline and where the QRS complex displays a periodic waxing and waning of amplitude on the electrogram, or vascular restriction as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Torsades De Pointes Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: An atypical rapid polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with a characteristic rotation of the QRS complex around the isoelectric baseline. In addition the QRS complex displays a periodic waxing and waning of amplitude on the electrogram. (NCI):an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.longName: Torsades De Pointes by ECG Finding
Concepts.definition: An electrocardiographic finding of an atypical rapid polymorphic ventricular tachycardia with a characteristic rotation of the QRS complex around the isoelectric baseline, occurring in the setting of a prolonged QT interval. In addition, the QRS complex displays a periodic waxing and waning of amplitude on the electrocardiogram.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
